thread.title: Yohji Yamamoto Plays With Psychedelic Prints for FW17
thread.title_full: Yohji Yamamoto Plays With Psychedelic Prints for FW17

author: Jonathan Sawyer
title: Yohji Yamamoto Plays With Psychedelic Prints for FW17
text:
Previous Next 
As we continue our coverage of Paris Men’s Fashion Week, here we showcase the FW17 delivery from Japanese designer Yohji Yamamoto. 
Back with a number of signature cuts and drapes, the overall feel of the collection is formal, with an emphasis placed on fanciful prints, harkening back decades prior. For those who find touches of color more to their liking, Yamamoto also has that in store, providing a little something for both conservative and more out-there tastes. 
Muted color palettes can also be see in the FW17 onslaught, while an artful camouflage pattern then makes a notable appearance as well. 
To get a feel for Yohji Yamamoto’s expansive FW17 collection, see the imagery above. 
For more coverage of FW17 Fashion Week, be sure to read our other reports on today’s hottest brands.
